intro_text: The Terraaia star system is located in the Orion Arm of the Milky Way galaxy, approximately 1,000 light-years from Earth. It consists of a G-type main-sequence star named Terraaia and its six orbiting planets.

Gliese 581 is a star system located about 20 light-years from Earth. It is a single star system, consisting of a red dwarf star. Gliese 581c is a confirmed exoplanet that orbits within the habitable zone of its star. It is one of the first Earth-sized exoplanets to be discovered. However, subsequent studies have suggested that Gliese 581c may be too hot to be habitable.

intro_text: Kepler-452b is a confirmed exoplanet that orbits within the habitable zone of its star. It is slightly larger and older than Earth, and it is one of the most Earth-like planets yet discovered. The star system is located about 1400 light-years from Earth.

Alpha Centauri is the closest star system to Earth, located about 4.37 light-years away. It is a triple star system, consisting of two Sun-like stars (Alpha Centauri A and Alpha Centauri B) and a red dwarf star (Proxima Centauri). Proxima b is a confirmed exoplanet that orbits within the habitable zone of Proxima Centauri. It is the closest known exoplanet to Earth.

The Jov Minora star system is home to the advanced alien civilization of the Jex, known for their peaceful and harmonious society, and their remarkable technological achievements in renewable energy and space exploration.

TRAPPIST-1 is a star system located about 39 light-years from Earth. It is the first known star system to have seven Earth-sized planets orbiting within its habitable zone. The planets are all very close to each other, and they are thought to be tidally locked to their star, meaning that the same side of each planet always faces the star.
